node.title: Airlines that dropped mask rules are now facing staff shortages
node.description: EasyJet said it had to scrap hundreds of flights due to staffers being infected with COVID-19.

node.title: Dunedin Study links vaccine hesitancy with childhood abuse
node.description: People's differing life histories should be taken in account so as to not scorn or belittle those now opposed to vaccines, the Dunedin Study director says. Audio

node.title: Homicide investigation after man allegedly shot and killed in East Auckland
node.description: A homicide investigation has been launched after a man was allegedly shot and killed at a house in East Auckland.

node.title: Auckland DHB still delaying elective surgery after Omicron peak
node.description: A month after the peak of Auckland's Omicron outbreak, senior doctors say adrenaline is giving way to trepidation as they call for an urgent return to business as usual.

node.title: Pharmacists ready to do more RATs to improve result accuracy
node.description: Pharmacists are putting their hands up to do more to help people get their rapid antigen tests (RATs) done properly and with more reliable results.

node.title: Alabama lawmakers pass transgender youth medication ban
node.description: The topic of transgender and LGBTQ identity has become one of the GOP's "wedge" issues aimed at securing votes because they are popular with the party's base.

node.title: Wall beds recalled after one falls on woman, killing her
node.description: Product sold online can detach and fall onto those nearby, posing serious impact and crush hazards, officials say.

node.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (April 10)
node.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the #1 Sunday morning news program

node.title: Retirements are again fueling a shortage in the labor force
node.description: The biggest share of people leaving the workforce in March was due to retirements, new study finds.

node.title: Atmospheric methane levels surged by a record amount in 2021: NOAA
node.description: Levels of carbon dioxide also increased at a "historically high rate," NOAA said.

node.title: Commercial crew set for historic SpaceX launch to space station
node.description: The flight is the first in a series sanctioned by NASA to encourage private-sector development in Earth orbit.

node.title: Interns at these companies can take home six figures
node.description: At gaming platform Roblox, internships offer median monthly pay of nearly $10,000 a month, Glassdoor data shows.

node.title: Over 1 million without power in Puerto Rico after fire causes major blackout
node.description: The blackout also left some 160,000 customers without water and snarled traffic across the island of 3.2 million people.

node.title: Manhattan DA says Trump criminal probe is ongoing
node.description: Alvin Bragg said in a statement Thursday that his investigators and prosecutors are "exploring evidence not previously explored"

node.title: Consumers spending less on fuel, groceries and takeaways as prices rise
node.description: More than two-thirds of consumers are cutting back on spending as a means of coping with inflation, with many looking for a hefty wage increase or considering a better paying job and other ways to…

node.title: Bird flu's grisly question: How to kill millions of poultry
node.description: Methods include using firefighting foam or filling barns with carbon dioxide. Animal welfare groups say that's cruel.

node.title: Russia booted from UN Human Rights Council
node.description: "We have collectively sent a clear message that Russia will be held accountable," said U.S. Ambassador Linda Thomas-Greenfield.

node.title: Deadly shooting in Tel Aviv: "A terrorist opened fire"
node.description: Tensions have been high after a series of deadly attacks by Palestinian assailants just ahead of the Islamic holy month of Ramadan.

node.title: Consumers spending less of fuel, groceries and takeaways as prices rise
node.description: More than two-thirds of consumers are cutting back on spending as a means of coping with inflation, with many looking for a hefty wage increase or considering a better paying job and other ways to…

node.title: Jackson confirmed to Supreme Court, making history as first Black female justice
node.description: The Senate voted 53-47 to confirm Jackson to the high court, with three Republicans joining all 50 Democrats to approve her nomination.

node.title: A GOP-controlled Senate could grind Biden's judicial nominations to a halt
node.description: The Senate has confirmed 58 of Mr. Biden's nominees to the U.S. trial courts and courts of appeals since he took office.

node.title: 'A real balancing act': Some resthomes ditching vaccine passes
node.description: Some resthomes are no longer requiring people to show vaccine passes before visiting loved ones after the relaxation of rules this week.

node.title: Walmart boosts annual pay for new truck drivers to $110,000
node.description: Nation's largest retailer is hiking salaries for drivers in its private fleet. Long-term drivers can earn even more, it said.

node.title: How the war ends in Ukraine is an "open question," top military officer says
node.description: Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Mark Milley told Congress the Ukrainians have been successful in defending Kyiv from Russia, but there will be a difficult fight in the Donbas.

node.title: Britney Spears objects to paying $663,000 of her mother's legal fees
node.description: In a hearing at a Los Angeles courtroom Wednesday, the pop star's lawyer argued that she should not have to pay her mother's $663,000 legal tab.

node.title: Britney Spears' latest legal battle is over her mother's legal fees
node.description: In a hearing at a Los Angeles courtroom Wednesday, the pop star's lawyer argued that she should not have to pay her mother's $663,000 legal tab.

node.title: GOP lawmakers want to punish Citi over its abortion benefits
node.description: Bank already helps workers foot the bill to travel for medical services like transplant or bariatric procedures.

node.title: Covid-19: Blood clot risk higher for six months after having virus
node.description: After a Covid-19 infection, there is an increased risk of developing a serious blood clot for the next six months, a study from Sweden suggests.

node.title: Evacuation orders, rescues as Sydney hit with torrential rain again
node.description: Sydney and large swathes of NSW's coast are enduring another day of downpours.

node.title: 'Pattern of breaches': Crowd funding platform fined thousands
node.description: An Australian-owned crowd funding platform has incurred a $7500 penalty for not filing financial statements on time.
